intro: Manicaria plukenetii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows in high-altitude regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsules as its fruit, containing numerous small seeds.
